newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Beijing Enterprises sets limit for int'l placement.
newsitem.headline: Beijing Enterprises sets limit for int'l placement.

text.p: Global coordinator Peregrine Capital Ltd said on Monday a limit had been set on the number of shares that may be subscribed for with each application in the international offering portion of shares in Beijing Enterprises Holdings Ltd.

In view of the strong market response, chairman Francis Leung of Peregrine Capital said "each application in the international offering is limited to a maximum of 10 percent of the issue size of the international placing portion."
Leung said the international offering portion had been dozens of times subscribed. There are 135 million shares earmarked for international placement.
"No restriction will be apply on the Hong Kong public offering portion," he added.

Beijing municipal government-controlled Beijing Enterprises said earlier on Monday it would offer 150 million shares in a global initial public offering (IPO) at HK$12.48 each, of which 10 percent of the issue would be offered in a Hong Kong public offering and 90 percent in an international placement.
It said it had granted underwriters an option to issue an additional 22.5 million shares to cover over-allotment.
The IPO in Hong Kong will run from May 20 to 23 and dealing in the company shares is due to begin on May 29.
Peregrine Capital Ltd and Morgan Stanley Asia Ltd are the joint global co-ordinators and joint sponsors of the issue.
